article.headline: South Carolina St. 79, N.C.-Asheville 77
article.story: ORANGEBURG, S.C. (AP) -- Brian Mason hit a jumper with 1.7 seconds to go to give South Carolina State a 79-77 win over North Carolina-Asheville on Thursday night. Asheville (4-8) was down 13 points with nine minutes to go before going on a 22-9 run to tie the game at 77 with 1:38 to go. Both teams turned the ball over on their next possession. South Carolina State then missed a jumper, but the ball went out of bounds off an Asheville player and South Carolina State (3-7) held for a final shot. The ball went to Mason, who hit a 10-foot jumper for the winning points. Mason led all scorers with 23 points. He shot 10-of-12 from the field and hit both his free throws. Julius Carter added 16 points, while Jason Flagler scored 10 points and had 10 rebounds for South Carolina State. Vincent James and K.J. Garland each had 22 points for Asheville, while Bryan Smithson added 11 points and five assists.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.
